archimate:ApplicationComponent.name: Cleaning & Encoding
archimate:ApplicationComponent.documentation: Cleaning and encoding - find the incorrect, incomplete, inaccurate, or irrelevant/missing data in context and then modifying, replacing, or deleting it. - Encoding is the process of categorizing ordinal and nominal data to facilitate machine learning in model development. ML requires that all input and output variables to be numeric. It is a required pre-processing step when working with categorical data for machine learning. - Disparate data types are hard to merge - Vibrations can be recorded as lengths of time or as frequencies; - temperatures can be in celsius or fahrenheit; - videos or images might not be to the same scale. - Timings can get out of step, especially when data are sampled at different rates. eg. aircraft communication systems send signals every few nanoseconds, but navigation systems record the position of a plane every second. Averaging fine data doesnâ€™t help because detail is lost.
